item.title: Rubbish still there, 16th July
item.description:
Following on from my report number 7878017 I have absolutely no idea how you were unable to locate an issue???? Please see attached photos - if anyone had actually visited the area to look for rubbish they would have seen this rubbish spread all over the grass. This response is totally unacceptable and I will be making a complaint to the council.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Picardy Road, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement outside Canada Water station needs a jet clean, 16th July
item.description:
I have complained previously about the need to jet clean the pavement around Canada Water station on Surrey Quays Road, outside the Sainsburys. It is covered in chewing gum. It seems neither TfL or Southwark Council feel responsible for this patch of ground, yet it has the highest footfall of the area and would benefit from a one off power clean. The government has provided funding for this, and it is inexpensive. Please can Southwark Council finally do this one simple but effective thing to enhance the local environment for most people?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Surrey Quays Road, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead tree & other new trees need assistance, 16th July
item.description:
Hi, If the 6 new trees in Tuftin Street, one is dead & all the others need new straps or straps adjusted as new growth is being restricted by them. Please can you assess & resolve? Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 62-64, Horseferry Road, Millbank, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car repeatedly parking too close to junction, 16th July
item.description:
Car repeatedly parking at edge of Park Hill too close to junction with Southborough Road. This means that cars approaching Southborough Road from Park Hill have to pull out onto opposite side of road. Anyone turning into Park Hill at the same time will collide and there will be an accident.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Hill, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manchester Square, Marylebone, London

item.title: Constant overflow of litter bins beside Decathalon and on Canada Street, 16th July
item.description:
There are a number of litter bins stationed along the pedestrian path next to Decathalon but they are often overflowing, especially at the weekend. This may be because of the local market or people walking home late at night. It means there is often litter strewn along the way. Please can we have more bins or more collections? Also, we have a problem with local residents leaving rubbish bags atop the bin next to the front entrance of Alfred Salter Primary School off Canada St. Foxes break into the bags and leave rubbish all along the pavement, where the schoolchildren walk. Please can we have some signage here telling people not to leave bags in the open, or CCTV to prevent this kind of fly tipping?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Surrey Quays Road, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped rubbish on A2, 16th July
item.description:
Pile of wood stacked up in hard shoulder of A2 London bound approaching Falconwood slip. Could easily fall into carriageway. Problem reported a week ago but was informed it’s TFL an issue. TFL state it’s a borough problem. Bottom line, it’s hazardous and could so easily fall into the carriageway and needs to be removed
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 885, East Rochester Way, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pouring greasy water into drain again, 16th July
item.description:
The staff were good for some days using clean water but started again using greasy water and making smelly with hot weather. Staff should rinse grease with tissue paper which will go into the bin not into drain on the street. They should learn and respect environment as don’t live in the area but earn money.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Binney Street, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet
